view

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds positional information about where a GameBoard should be rendered on the Canvas. It supplies methods for calculating the rendering position of a given GameBoard, as well as methods for changing the view.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)

    • Method Detail

      • getCenterOffsetRenderingPosition

        public Point getCenterOffsetRenderingPosition(GameBoard board)
        Calculates the rendering position of a given board. The position is centered as default, and can be changed with the move() method.
        Parameters:
        board - The board to calculate the position from.
        Returns:
        A Point containing the starting coordinates of where the board should be rendered.

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double newZoomValue)
        Sets the zoom value.
        Parameters:
        newZoomValue - The zoom value - minimum value is 1.

      • getZoom

        public double getZoom()

      • move

        public void move(GameBoard board,
                 double x,
                 double y)
        Moves the camera.
        Parameters:
        board - The board that is currently rendered.
        x - How much the camera should be moved horizontally.
        y - How much the camera should be moved vertically.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the camera zoom and position.
